comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Not 100% sure, but I bet this is Singleton's Mill on the Hawkesbury River, now demolished. GoogleMapsSatellite - maps.google.com.au/maps?ll=-33.463226,151.072035&spn=...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: See Australian Town & Country Journal 02/09/1902 p.22 with illustration which looks very similar with a bit of imagination - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71485488 The mill was built in the 1830s (?) and fell into disrepair after the flood of 1867. There is a GHOST!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for the information beachcomberaustralia. It does look a lot like it and there are other images from the same series in our Hall collection. We'll upload the others and see if they can throw any new light.

It must be a ghost! :) The article says it was still standing and that was in 1903. Interesting...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, it is interesting, specially if there are more images to come.  Unfortunately I am going o/s for a few weeks so will not be able to give this the time and attention it deserves.  Do not think I am ignoring you, please!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Oh no! That's a shame, although do enjoy your trip, and when you get back you'll be able to see plenty of new uploads. We will just have to wait. :)
